subject: Cable Television
Football
lead_paragraph: The NFL Network filed a complaint with the Federal Communications Commission against Comcast in the latest legal wrangling between the sides. The NFL Network accused Comcast, the nation’s largest cable operator, of discriminatory and anticompetitive treatment in violation of the Cable Act of 1992. The sides have been feuding over Comcast’s decision to place the NFL Network on a premium sports tier for which customers must pay extra to receive. The NFL Network sued Comcast in October 2006 over the move.
